info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:25PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND WESTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 125 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Mesa to 12 miles west of Hope. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell and Roswell Correctional Facility. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 104 and 144. Highway 380 near Mile Marker 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
